Reviews.Title: “A shambles”
Reviews.Author: Sandra281990
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on a hotel but feel this time i should. The good points: room size ok. Good shower. Clean The bad points: too far away from the city had to get cabs everytime to go into town. The pool was not in use so we were allowed to sit around it but could not go in, (very disappointing as this was one of the reasons why we booked the hotel!) We had a shower and the warm steam from it set off some sort of alarm and reception rang us up and accused us of smoking in the room. No bar facilities at all, just a vending machine. Breakfast was awfull, hot dogs and cold rubber scrambled egg. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Stu B
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 3 night stay in this hotel having book a cheap late deal. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Clean, quiet and the staff were friendly and spoke english. The beds were a bit hard as we are used to soft mattress but everyone has different preferences in this regard. Good selection for Breakfast and the pool facility was nice. Not far from metro providing easy access to the city centre. Would consider this hotel if in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Babzy75
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed a 3 night stay in this hotel with my friend. We were very impressed, clean, quiet and very friendly staff (especially Victor :-)). Breakfast good, location ok- not too hard to get into the centre and the pool was just what the doctor ordered! We are going again!

Reviews.Title: “Amaral just perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: aylott817
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Amaral in Madrid,went with my son to watch Real Madrid and stayed here. Hotel was about 15 mins walking distance from the stadium,staff were very helpful and hotel was very clean.Breakfast was superb with eggs ,bacon ,cereals,cheeses hams etc,first class. Thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice photo, but it's not their pool!”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel for the price. Small room, no mini bar, iron,hairdryer or bath. Has a small bar/cafe which never seems to be open. My partner was embarrissingly asked to leave the pool by a lifeguard for reasons he could not make clear. When we took this up with reception he just shrugged and said that the pool belongs to the local community and they are allowed only a very limited amount of passes. Madrid has many good hotels so i would advise you to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: DMGuate
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice. The room was fine. Defintely nothing special. The bed was horribly uncomfortable. Neither of us slept well because of it. The walls were very thin and we could hear our next door neighbors even if they were just having a conversation. Thankfully there were few people staying when we were there. The breakfast was a nice option, although extremely overpriced for the quality of food. I would recommend going up the street to the restaurant a block away. I would look for a different place to stay if I was in Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you find any promotion”
Reviews.Author: PandK06
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, rooms clean, but quiet small. A bit far from touristic center, but close to financial center and metro stations. Varied breakfast and a big pool. For the price in its webpage, doesn't worth the money, compared to similar hotels in center, but with a big promotion, i recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Pietro D
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good position, it is 5 minutes walking from the metro station and very close to the Santiago Bernabeu Stadium. The rooms are nice and very clean, the people of the reception are always very kind and helpful. The breakfast is very good. the price/quality ratio of the Sunotel Amaral is really excellent

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but far away from center”
Reviews.Author: Gmail1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on average, but not really clean. Our shower wasn't working well. The towels were not enough. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “nice small kept secret”
Reviews.Author: rookesh
Reviews.Content: Hotel centrly located .Metro station 5 minutes walk .Close to Barnubeu stadium about 15 minutes walk .Rooms are small but very neat .Gentleman at the front was very helpull and polite.Lots of eating places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel just what we needed, very close to tetuan metro which made it easy to get to where we wanted. Nice hotel and dec”
Reviews.Author: Kittikat86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for our stay in Madrid, close to the bernabou stadium and right by the tetuan station which made it very easy to get to where we wanted! Short ride to the centre! Lovely hotel, nice rooms just what we needed and decent breakfast with yummy pastries!! Would stay again friendly staff! Only thing I would say is the wifi is not the best in all rooms we didn't have good connection but unless ur their on business then it's not an issue coz I certainly wasn't bothered as I was on holiday and wasn't there to sit on the Internet! Lovely city that needs to be enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel Style Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Aaron B
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, rooms are similar style to single rooms in a hostel. The staff were poorly trained but very friendly. My TV didn't work on arrival so I was moved to another room, then in the morning I was told I needed to move back to the original room. When I pointed out that this was inconvenient to me I was told by 1 person that the new room was already booked out and by another person that the new room was only for emergencies. I was moved back despite my objection. The shower head also didn't stay up making showering difficult, although a wedged in soap helped. Location was useful for my purpose, but otherwise the "Sauna Bar" to next door and the hookers on the high street aren't a great look. Bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. A tip for the TV is that you can actually set the dubbed shows back to English, hit the green button on the remote. Don't do the breakfast! Stale pastries and soggy cold bacon. Didn't try the eggs, because the tray was empty and wasn't re-filled for some time...

Reviews.Title: “Sunotel Amaral”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to metro station and ideal for Santiago Bernabeu. Comfortable, price very reasonable. Reception staff very helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baparella
Reviews.Content: Such good value for money. I have stayed in the Sunotel Amaral 3 times now, as it's location fits my purpose, and I would never go elsewhere! Rooms are clean and well presented, comp wi-fi is a great bonus! Whilst it is situated outside of the centre, there are good bars and restaurants close by and Tetuan station (5mins walk) will take you straight through to Sol and a taxi back isn't too expensive should you be out late at night. Reception staff are always helpful and breakfast is what would be expected of a hotel of this standard. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Madrid on a budget and look forward to returning soon

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, otherwise average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: When I say "Good location" I say this because it is very easy to get to the centre on the metro from this hotel, also it is near Real Madrid's stadium. It is a little way out of the centre but I think this has advantages. Unlike in or near Sol (central Madrid), there are no seedy characters or beggers around, It is much easier to find a supermarket, the restaurants are cheaper and aren't touristy. I also stayed in Sol and I prefer the location of the Sunotel. The rooms are average, comfortable enough. The door key is hard to use and I sometimes had to fiddle with it, other people were having trouble with it too. No English language TV stations but it's like that everywhere in Spain! I stayed here for three nights. The first night was my own booking and the other two were part of a tour. On the morning of 12 March I asked the guy at the counter to print something for me. It was the same guy who checked me in the day before. He did it then when I went to get the print out he asked me to pay 10 euros for breakfast. I said I didn't have breakfast and that it wasn't a part of my booking. He said he knew I didn't have breakfast but that I had to pay anyway... So I did thinking maybe it was written on my booking form from hotels.com somewhere (which I later checked and it wasn't), this seemed very dodgy and I later saw in the elevator that the price of breakfast was not even 10 euros, it was 14!. Other interactions I had with the staff indicated that some were not that polite overall, however they seemed to speak English to a reasonable degree. Having said that, on the other two nights I stayed as part of a tour, the breakfast was included and it is particularly good at this place. I wouldn't stay here again though because of the 10 euro breakfast incident.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Gem
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in a twin room for 3 nights on our first visit to Madrid. I can't comment on the rack rate as we got it as part of a package deal, but the rate we paid was excellent value. It was very easy to find the hotel from the closest metro stop, it is about a five minute walk along one of the main roads (opposite the bright red vips convenience store). The reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was an adequate size, very clean and kitted out in a modern style. I really appreciated the hairdryer which saved me from packing mine and shower was powerful with plenty hot water. The only problem I found was their wasn't an overhead light in the main room, just lamps and there was a shortage of plug sockets so we did most of our dressing/make up etc in the bathroom. The breakfast was very good. The selection was typical of a Spanish chain hotel buffet (cereals, pastries, cheeses, breads with a toaster, hot food, tortillas, jams, fruit, hot drinks and juices). There was plenty of it, it was fresh and constantly kept stocked and tidy. It was very easy to get from the hotel to the sights. You're about a 10 minute walk to the home of Real Madrid and to get further afield their metro system is convenient and very easy to use. It's similar in size to London's tube system but their carriages are more spacious and they run from about 6am until about 2am. It goes to the airport too which makes for a hassle free journey into the city. My tip would be if you're flying in with easyjet, buy one of their tourist transport passes (advertised in their sky shop mag and covers 3 days). We didn't rush around everything and we used two 10 ticket passes each plus an extra single ticket back to the airport). If I go back, which I hope to do someday, I'd be happy to stay here again and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “clean modern hotel on quiet street”
Reviews.Author: forbenjoy
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed 2 nights in madrid at the sunotel amaral and will return next week since we liked it so much. while it is not in an action packed area such as grand via or plaza del sol, there is a good selection of restaurants just down the street from the sunotel. the metro is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. the neighborhood is quiet enough that we were able to leave our window open at night without having the street noise that you would have in the busier section of madrid. this was necessary because the climate system had been changed to heat -- but the weather was too warm for the heat, so we shut it off in our room and opened the window. our electrical adapter did not fit the outlet -- the hotel maintenance man was kind enough to give us one that took care of the connection, which meant we were able to use the (free wifi) internet. the breakfast buffet was included,so we ate there. there was plenty of selection, but if it was not included, i would not have eaten there for the 14 euros per person charge. one note -- if you are american, skip the pastries, which are not at all sweet ( however, the savory ones were quite tasty). the room was clean and spacious. the shower was strong. the bed was firm and comfortable. overall, i'd say the hotel provided just what we look for in a hotel while vacationing -- not a luxurious place, but a clean comfortable space to shower and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for Real Madrid game”
Reviews.Author: Nandrq
Reviews.Content: We decided to attend a Real Madrid game (amazing experience) and wanted to stay walking distance to the stadium. Found this hotel through hotels.com. It was perfect for what we needed. It was cheaper than most other hotels in the area and about a 15 minute (safe) walk to the stadium. This is a great value, no frills hotel and that was all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel with Good Service”
Reviews.Author: LincolnshireIngo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as I had football tickets for Real Madrid. The hotel is ideally located for this purpose. The check in procedure was very quick and hassle free. The staff spoke good English and were very helpful. The rooms were a decent size and were very comfortable. My only moan was that the room smelt smokey and this was supposed to be a non smoking room. Apart from this the rooms were well maintained and were very clean. Breakfast was also very good and there was plenty of choice. There are a number of commercial restaurants in the area but if you want small local tapas then you may have to look further afield. The Metro (Cuzco) was only a 7 minute walk and the hotel was easy to find. All in all this is a good little hotel which if travelling to Madrid again I would consider using again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Genesis8269
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my 30th birthday in Madrid and stayed at this hotel. It is directly across from a business where men pay for sex. It is called a sauna. No bueno! I never slept over night in my room. The staff accused me of having multiple people sleep in my room which was not true. I used the room to shower and store my things. I was always gone until the afternoon. The two persons who visited me in my room are family whom reside in Madrid who have fancy homes. Why would they sleep in this small hotel which has trash around it. Such bad street cleaning. But the rest of the neighbor hood is nice! Makes no sense. The staff here are rude, nosey, will falsely accuse you of things and lastly some of my clothes were stolen and I was charged a extra 100$ for my company stay. Like I said I never even slept in my hotel room. Stay at AC Marriott one block away by Cuzco. The staff will treat you like the human being with kindness like you deserve.

Reviews.Title: “5 day trip”
Reviews.Author: GiusiV
Reviews.Content: Do Good money value Good position: restaurants and shops walking distance The pool is nice Don't Rooms don't have a mini fridge but there is a fresh drink machine

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: thudor
Reviews.Content: A very adequate hotel for business travel located close to UNWTO. Check in was quite smooth but one has to make the entire payment for the stay during check-in and no proper receipt is provided. I received a mail from them on my return but on replying to let me know of a shirt I had left behind there was no response. Walking distance to a small shopping area on Calle Orense with El Cortes Englese Department store and others like H&M, Zara etc.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION IS BEST ASSET”
Reviews.Author: Marta R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was attending a conference at the Palacio de Congresos and it is within walking distance. The neighborhood is safe and there are two metro stations nearby. The property is well kept, the rooms, althogh not particularly attractive, are clean and so are the bathrooms. But the personnel are not really very helpful or polite. They take ages to solve your requests and even then, the answer is sometimes "no" (we can't turn the air conditioning on, we don't have more clothes hangers, etc.). I would reccomend this place to solo business travelers who have meetings at the Palacio de Congresos.

Reviews.Title: “If you didn't know it existed.. GO!!!”
Reviews.Author: edwie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a good deal I got during those days. Was hesitant at first because it is located in Cuzco, which is in the northern part of Urban Madrid, close to the Bernabeu Stadium. I always stay in the Center of the City but this time I decided to give this a try. What a fantastic hotel!!! It is located in a very nice neighborhood, in a quiet street with hardly any traffic. The surroundings are beautiful and you can find grocery shops, restaurants, and much more. It is close to two metro stations: Tetuan (about a 6 min walk) and Cuzco (a 10 min walk, located in Paseo de la Castellana). A metro ride to the center should be between 15-20 min in any of the two lines (9 Tetuan or 10 Cuzco) The hotel in itself was incredible. Flat screen TV, a king bed, very comfortable and clean, well lit rooms, free wifi, air conditioning and very efficient front desk staff. I even needed to print out my boarding pass for an upcoming flight and the receptionist gladly offered to do it for me. Another good point is that it is not a big hotel. It has a medium sized restaurant, a nice small lobby and it is very quiet, very aparthotel like. So for those seeking a quiet stay, it is perfect. If you like the area of La Castellana, Bernabeu, etc., definitely stay here, it is worth every penny. If you prefer the traditional Madrid circuit, I would recommend something closer to the center (Plaza del Sol).

Reviews.Title: “Thieves operate at this hotel - beware!”
Reviews.Author: HairyGerry
Reviews.Content: If you do not want your purse with the passport and credit cards stolen out of hotel lobby right in front of you 10 minutes before you have to go back to the airport, do not stay here. The reception desk will not help you. In fact, they forgot any language other than Spanish. They did not alarm the police. There are no surveillance cameras even at reception - so basically anyone can go inside the hotel. As a matter of fact, we are thinking the receptionist was working together with the thieves as two men who allegedly stole our bag were coming from inside the hotel, and the only person who knew we were checking out and had no time to start investigation was receptionist. This is outrageous. Please choose a better hotel with no thieves at the hotel lobby and helpful front desk who can at least speak some English and alarm the police. We cannot return our passports or valuables, but at least we can prevent more thefts to be staged at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: konsara
Reviews.Content: We were 4 persons and we booked 2 twins rooms for 4 days in a very good price from roomsnet.com. The hotel is close to metro station Cuzco(blue line 10) or station Tetuan(line 1). In 30'min. from the airport you are in the hotel. If you want to see attractions you can take from "Cuzco square" a lot of Buses lines that brings you in Sol(number 5) or near Prado Museum (number 27or 147) , "Atocha rail station"(number 27). The hotel is not in the center Madrid but you have good connections. The rooms were very clean and comfortable in good size.TV satelite, hair dryer. The staff was very friendly.The breakfast was great with a variety of goods like cheese,ham,marmelade, jabon, different kind of small breads, juices,coffe etc.Near the hotel is a super market in good prices to take water and 2 blocks(streets) down the hotel there is a famousin Madrid restaurant "Museum de Jamon" with very good food in good prices.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Katsolo
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this Hotel after having travel for over 30 hours from New Zealand.. I was a fragile mess and severly sleep deprived when I got there. The receptionist was understanding and outstanding. She spoke English and checked me in very quickly. I arrived in my room at around 7pm, hung a do not disturb sign on the door, closed the curtains and then sleeped for the next 15 hours in peace. It was a very quiet Hotel. I liked that breakfast was from 8-11am as it allowed me to cruise into my first day. The breakfast was outstanding. I mean you have to love a place that has desserts for breakfast. The hot breakfast, pastries, cheeses were yummy and set me up well for the day and saved me a lot of money as I didnt need lunch. i found the room was big, clean and the bed was comfortable. Spanish mattresses seem to be quite firm and I liked that. Having a safe in the room was an advantage as well. The bathroom was large and the bath was a welcome treat. All the staff that I came into contact with where lovely. The Hotel is away from the main attractions but the bus and metro were 5 mins away. I felt safe as a lone female traveller coming back from the CBD at 12am and walking back to the Hotel from the metro. You can catch a train from the airport to Cuzco and then walk the 5 min to the Hotel. I was going to do this but was too jetlagged when I arrived. However, if you do decide to do this, beware that there are some steep steps coming out of the metro, so besure you can carry your bag by hand if needed. I always travel with a bag that has both wheels and a backpack option for that very reason. I caught a taxi to the Hotel at a cost of 19 euro which I thought was pretty good, it cost me $330 NZ dollars for three nights which I booked through the NZ STA website. I thought that was very good value for money. I am planning on going to Morrocco next year and will be flying into Madrid first and will definalty come back and stay in this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: katana55
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Sunotel Amaral for 6 days. The location is far away from almost anything (Except Bernabeu stadium, which is a big plus for football fans). But this is hardly a problem, since the Metro network is great in Madrid. The nearest metro station (Cuzcó) is about 5 minutes away, the other (Tetuán) is about 7 minutes, but it is usually more useful. Still, if you want to hang out late at night, I would go for a hotel which is located exactly in the center, to avoid the walk from metro station to the hotel. The room was very clean, it had a bath. The bad was comfortable. There was a free safebox in the closet. Nevertheless, the view from the window is quite ugly. The staff was really helpful, especially in the cases that we needed to order pizza, a taxi, etc, since the local folk don't know English. The breakfast was good, lots of options. I especially liked the selection of meat and cheese. In one sentence, I would have recommended this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a great holiday in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: animaniac90
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant when my girlfriend and I recently visited Madrid. The room was large, clean and comfortable, and the hotel in general was very nice. The staff were friendly and helpful (and spoke very good English), and the buffet breakfast was very good. There is a swimming pool, but we didn't use it. The only possible downside we thought it might have is its location, but that didn't turn out to be a problem at all. While it is out of the centre, it is less than 5 minute's walk to two different Metro stations and took us less than 20 minutes to get from the hotel to the city centre every day. Also, it is in what appeared to be mainly a business district, but there are plenty of bars and restaurants around which meant that it didn't feel in the middle of nowhere - and it is very close to the Bernabeu stadium too, which is good for football fans! Price-wise, we booked the whole holiday through Easyjet, and got four nights for the price of three - we did see it listed elsewhere for a higher price per night, so possibly worth shopping around for the best deal on this hotel. Overall, we had a great trip to Madrid and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased for last minute reservation.”
Reviews.Author: arekwarzycha
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid this May for the Champions League Final 2010. I got my ticket on Monday so I searched many hotels until I reached to this one. This was my only choice because I did not want to spend so much money on a 3-day weekend. All other hotels were very expensive since they were almost all full due to this big athletic event. I found this hotel from a third-party site. Generally I was pleased with the hotel since I found it last minute but under normal circumstances nothing would have impressed me. The room was quite modern but small. ( I didnt really care about the room because I actually only used it to sleep). The breakfast was fine, not very big but you could get enough food. There is no restaurand in the hotel but only a snack-bar so lunch and dinner I had to eat outside. Service was good, everything that I asked for or any questions that I had were resolved. The hotel was located close to the Stadium but quite far to the city center but the Metro which is very close to the hotel helped me to get to anywhere I wanted very fast. Generally I was happy with my stay but I wouldnt stay again if I had to choose between other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town but great for transport network and real madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gannochy
Reviews.Content: We traveled to watch a Real Madrid game so the location was the main factor in picking this hotel With the great Metro network in Madrid its easy to get to the center and all other attractions within minutes at a low cost The hotel was clean and the room was great. The only thing missing was a tea or coffee machine

Reviews.Title: “A little bit far from town, but decent stay”
Reviews.Author: msukevtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, was booked by our tour group. A few general things about European hotels I've learned on my travels: - all tend to be small - don't pull the cord in the shower, it supposedly signals an alarm to the front desk for help - walls are thin - I still don't know how to use that other bowl shaped sink-faucet thing next to the toilet The hotel was pretty clean and modern. The size of the room was good. One odd thing was the shower did not have a curtain or sliding door, rather a divider between the tub and sink. The divider does not cover too much, so a lot of water gets sprayed out on the ground. The breakfast had some pretty good pastries. The staff was nice and helpful describing the area. They also helped set us up with a taxi early in the morning. The location is a bit away from the city, but it is relatively close to the metro. Too bad it's not closer to town. Overall, it's a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Dizzy_gal_linds
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights at the start of August. We chose this particular hotel because it was on the metro line and had a swimming pool. We didn't want to stay right in the centre of Madrid. The location of the hotel is ideal, only a 5 minute walk to the metro line and in a safe area. The journey into the city centre is only about 10-15 minutes and the metro was very easy to use. Our room was very clean and appeared quite new. The shower was extremely powerful..watch out!! The room had a small mini bar, but we used this to store our own bottled water and other drinks. The storage space was good and there was a safe in our wardrobe which was handy. There was flat screen t.v in the room but only one English channel and a sports channel which my boyfriend didn't mind watching as it had the Arsenal game on! This room was definately perfect for us. We were on a bed and breakfast package which was handy. The breakfast compromised of bread, cereal, hams, cheeses, cakes/croissants, omlettes, and some 'fry-up' food. The breakfast was adequate for us as we arent too fussy. 3 days of eating this was a bit overwhelming though! There are a few restaurants near the hotel but we went into the city each night to eat dinner...bear in mind that the Spanish do it quite late! The swimming pool area was very clean and is a real sun trap. There are plenty of loungers and umbrellas. The pool itself was pretty cold....most people braved it but i just dipped my feet in which was enough to cool me off. There is a lifeguard on duty and you are supposed to present a card to him which is given to you at reception. Overall we had a pleasant stay at the Sunotel...perfect for a city break but not directly in the city centre. The staff were very friendly and were able to assist when we asked to have a late checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jamsie65
Reviews.Content: I spent almost a week in the amaral with a friend. We got a great deal including breakfast. No complaints about the hotel. The staff were nice in general, although sometimes the men at the reception came across as a little officious, business-like in their manner. But that is really a very very minor complaint. The location is really handy for getting to the centre and you don't have to deal with inner-city, clamorous Madrid nightlife (unless you're part of it, of course!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel within easy reach of city centre!”
Reviews.Author: Brummy_TravellerUK
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel for anyone wanting a comfortable, clean hotel from which to explore Madrid. Whilst it is set out a little distance from the city centre in the Northern part of the city, this is not a problem with good Metro connections about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The nearest Metro stops are Cuzco or Tetuán on lines 10 and 1 respectively. The hotel room was very clean, quiet and comfortable, with an especially welcoming power shower at the end of a long day's excursion in the heat. The air conditioning worked well. Staff at the hotel were friendly and all spoke good English, which was a bonus since our command of Spanish was rather limited! The area surrounding the hotel is a mix of commercial offices and residential, so we found travelling into the city was easier for seeking food and refreshment. There are a number of local supermarkets nearby. The buffet breakfast was excellent. Choice of juices, coffee and a selection of teas. Cereals, cold meats, cheese, fruit, yoghurts, cakes and pastries are available together with a selection of breads and rolls. Bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, omelette and tortilla are also available. Breakfast is served from 0700-1100 (0800 at weekends). The hotel has an outdoor pool available to guests of the hotel which is shared with local residents. This is open between July and mid-September. A €10 deposit per person is left at reception and you can use the pool for a maximum of 2 hours. We found the best time to go was around 5pm when there was lots of sun still basking the terrace, plenty of loungers available and a pleasant atmosphere with other users. After the heat of the day a dip in the cool pool was most welcome. The pool is supervised by an attendant.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Rubia22
Reviews.Content: I travel to Madrid regularly and always stay at the same 4 star hotel (part of a chain) in the Eastern part of the city (Las Ventas). I decided to make a change for my August visit and was pleased to find a hotel with access to a swimming pool to make the August heat more bearable. I was encouraged by the previous reviews of the Sunotel Amaral and even more pleased with my own experience. For those who know Madrid or those who prefer to be just outside the city centre, I highly recommend the Sunotel Amaral, particularly when the pool is open (mid-June - mid-September). The pool is shared with an apartment complex nearby and guests are limited to two hours a day, but that is usually sufficent. Not many people go to Madrid to lay by the pool! Take your own beach towel -- none are provided. It may also be helpful to know that there are three breakfast options: full buffet, American, and Continental. This was only explained when I asked. Breakfast was not included with my room deal. My room was very clean and comfortable. My only very monor complaint is that there were only 3 hangers in the wardrobe. For area restaurants, I recommend Pizza Jardin on Calle Pensamiento. It is part of a successful chain -- they have the right formula! There were a few others nearby that looked good, but they were closed during the month of August. I will definitely return to the Sunotel Amaral and its very friendly staff soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GCanuck33
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week. The objective of our trip was sightseeing, visiting museums and trying out Spanish food so we were in the hotel only at night. The staff are friendly, accommodating and helpful. The room very clean and probably recently renovated. The bed was only a double and the room small by Canadian standards but very comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was included in our package so we expected a muffin and a coffee but we found lots of options: scrambled eggs, bacon, different kind of hams, breads, sweet bun, juices. We found the cheapest and most efficient way of moving around was the Metro. There are two subway stations on different lines only two blocks away and downtown is only 20 minutes away. There are a couple of supermarkets nearby where we could buy some fruit and wine for the evening. The only problem we had was that we could not connect to the Internet the first night but it was fixed promptly when we reported it to the front desk. We definitely would go back to the Sunhotel Amaral

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RafaellaCheshire
Reviews.Content: We went for a long week-end. The hotel was spotless, the room adequate. The only thing we found was that the air conditioning was not cool enough and we were disappointed that there was no bar at the hotel but otherwise we could not fault it. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did get lost when we arrived and would advise those of you going to get the Metro from the airport. It cost E2 (euros) and was very easy to use. You get off at Cuzco, come out of the station and take a hairpin right. Cross the road to your left (you will see a cafe called Rodilla). After crossing the road, bear right and keep on the path left down Calle de Angelina de la Cruz, cross 2 roads and take the next left by the Kufxa. The hotel is on your right next to Fitness First. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the Metro. Each metro journey costs E1 but you can buy 10 trips for E7 or a 3 day pass, which we wish we had bought as that would have been very economical. The Metro is clean and easy to use. If you want to see the centre of Madrid you need to get off at SOL. It was a very interesting city with lots to see. .If you are interested in football, the hotel is about a 15 min walk from the Bernabeu stadium. We would recommend staying at the Amaral. Jan Oarton

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smullen465
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week, and we never had any bother at all. Its clean, and quite a decent size room. The air conditioning was a blessing! The staff were always happy to help and it was nice to have the pool, even if it was freezing!! They clean the room daily and change your towels everyday. Its not as close to madrid as what the map says on this site, but its just a short walk to cuzco metro, and its only 1euro to ride to anywere!! Very handy to get to all the good sight seeing attractions. I would warn anyone if getting a taxi to the hotel from the airport, we got charged 58 euros!!! when you can pay two euros each to go on the metro! which is very easy to use might i add!! There are quite a few nice restaurants nearby, and supermarkets, theres also a handy burger king and macdonalds nearby... just incase you want to play safe with the food! So overall i enjoyed my stay, and would reccommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night. My room had a musty smell to it and I thought it was a smoking room. When I checked with reception they said it was not a smoking room and the hotel was fully booked so I could not change rooms. Housekeeping came straight away and agreed about the smell. She sprayed something to freshen up the room but when I came back a few hours later the smell as back! Also the duvet had cigarette holes in it. Apart from these issues the room was a nice size and convenient for my trip (close to the concert venue). I would probably stay at a different hotel if I need to be in this area of Madrid again as there are several hotels to choose from. I think I was probably unlucky with the room I got here as there are so many positive reviews from other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Madrid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrJalla
Reviews.Content: I booked the amaral through the www.spanair.com website for a stay during an extended weekend (thursday to sunday) in late july and I found it to be an excellent choice for me and my needs. I come from Sweden, am 27 years old and travelled alone. Partly chose the Amaral because of their resonably priced doublebed rooms for single person use. Generally speaking the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. All of them spoke good english (by spanish standards excellent english) and had a good knowledge about the area around the hotel as far as tips about restaurants and so went. The room was good, nothing stellar but what you would expect for the price range. All was very clean and tidy and the pool was nice, but a little cold. The hotel is located outside of the immediate city center and metro ride takes about 5-10 minutes depending on where in the center you are going to. Only a couple of minutes to the subway though so no problem there. Also unless you have tons of luggage take the metro to the hotel from the airport, works really easy, just one quick change and short distance from metro station Cuzco to Hotel. Metro from the airport is 2€, (yes that is two Euro) cab ride apparently costs around 30€... Also since the hotel is not in the super-center of the city but rather in a comercial/residential area (seemed middle-to upper middle class and safe) it is much more quiet than the center of the city. Before booking I noted many of the hotels in Madrid had bad comments for much noice in the night, this was no big problem at the Amaral. There were some guests (i assume) that were noisy and the walls are not that soundproof but I think it must have been much better than in the center. I had no problems sleeping at least, beds were a little to hard for my taste... I personaly wanted a quiet, not to expensive hotel for a stay were I visited the museums and sights of Madrid and not primarily to party. I was also very interested in the pool since Madrid in July is very hot (we had about 38 degrees C) and I wanted to be able to take a swim when I got home from a tiring day in the city and lay by the pool. The pool area was ok, but not that special, the pool is very cold (not heated) and was open between 11-21 on weekdays and 10-20 on weekends. It sounds generous but I was usually only able to use the pool for about an hour before it closed since I was in the city during day. It would have been nice to be able to take a morning swim or a nigtly swim around 22-23 but that is not possible as the pool area is closed then. Also I did not choose the buffet breakfast that was on offer, I never had it so can't really comment on taste, it didn't look worth the 13€ a pop in my opinon though. There were alternatives with just coffey and toast at something like 5€ but i had breakfast at cafées in the city instead, also an excellent café for breakfast just round the corner from the hotel. More ambiance as well as cheaper (2-5 € depending on what I ate, although no buffé at that price). I would recomend the Amaral to all that want a quiet, reasonably high standard hotel at a resonable price. Specially if you would like the pool. If you are out to meet people and party all night long you may be better off in the city center but of course no problem to go into the city in the evening if you want to since there is the metro, cabs etc. Pool would I suppose make it a bonus for families with kids...

Reviews.Title: “Sunotel amaral - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Raksu
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, staff also and there was even a parking hall for our rental car, which was a plus. 5-10 minute walk to nearby metro stations, 15 minutes to the city, not too bad in such a bif city. Breakfast ok, cleanliness too, nothing to complain. Only minus was the sound proofing of the door, we could hear everything from the corridor and it was not nice to wake up every morning when the cleaning ladies started chit-chatting loudly at 8.00... Otherwise a good three-star hotel and quality-price ratio was fine. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny Madrid”
Reviews.Author: stephen_mcneill
Reviews.Content: Went with my son who always wanted to go to madrid. Stayed at this hotel, got to say i was very impressed. Room very clean and towels changed daily. Was a bonus having air con as the weather was extremely hot. Pool was ok but the sun gets blocked out by buildings at 6pm. The male staff were very helpful but female staff seemed to like to take there time dealing with you. Hotel only 5 minute walk from the metro station and 10 minute walk to the amazing santiago bernabeu stadium. Also went to the zoo, nature park, water park and the athletico madrid tour. Went for a week and enjoyed our stay very much, would go back to this hotel in the future if iam ever back in madrid (i hope).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location for a correct price”
Reviews.Author: JoaozinhoLondon
Reviews.Content: Good location, 5 min walk to two different tubes and situated 15 min walk from the barnabeu. Nothing around but the the tube is 15 min to the center. Rooms are clean and classic, good shower, staff is friendly, good breakfast. Only disapointing point was the swimming pool is open only from June to September. You can take a taxi to the airport from there for 30 euros.(20 min ride)

Reviews.Title: “short break in madrid”
Reviews.Author: buchananGlasgow
Reviews.Content: this hotel was clean and the staff were friendly. it is in a good location , near the bus and metro station, also the real madrid stadium.you can travel on the metro for only 1euro, that covers all the lines for cross over travel from one line to another. the bus also cost us only 1euro for any number of stop's.one note of warning , my partner had his wallet stolen on the metro on our last night in madrid, it was in his front pocket, there are only a few seats on the trains so that you have to hold onto the overhead railing to keep your balance. the cost of a taxi from the airport was 26euro's, so the metro is great for just 1euro per person and the station is right inside the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price... not bad location”
Reviews.Author: rmatos79
Reviews.Content: Hotel: new.. good conditions, very good rooms, very clean... quite zone, with supermarkets near by and the stadium of Real Madrid! Location: not bad... you have subway (Cuzcos) at 300m, it´s only 15m to get to the center of Madrid! Price... good.. I have paid 2 persons/night 80 euros, not very expensive for the quality and other prices in the dowtown of Madrid! Good hotel for travellers...I went there by Ryanair.. by subway.. 25m to the airport of Barajas.....! you can book by the internet directly.. without paying anything before...! It´s a good Choise to youg people who want to travel with some quality.. at "low cost"...

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Check in was slow. There seemed to be only one person working there. The room and bathroom were very clean and well maintained. My only beef was that they did not have a clock. At checkout I had left the key in the room. They said they could not check me out until they called someone. They said it may take a while, but it took only a minute or so. The clerk seemed kind of annoyed I locked the key inside. They have a restaurant serving breakfast, but I did not use it.

HotelInfo.Name: Sunotel Amaral
HotelInfo.Address: C/ General Verela 37, 28020 Madrid, Spain
